TASK.TITLE: Future releases
Update documentation for checkboxview
Allow controls at caption level
TASK.COMMENTS:
My idea is,
When a caption node has no caption, simply don't add it to the x,y calculation and give the next available node under it with window items, that x,y position. This way it appears like they are drawn at icon level.But what happens when the icon is in collapse mode?

TASK.TITLE: Look into unicode build
#0000092 Revise redrawing for checkboxes
TASK.COMMENTS: Sometimes the checkboxes are not properly drawn. Why is the OnClick checkbox (when checked) redrawn properly but others are not? The wxClientDC does not always issue a redraw. This might be fixed in 2.5.3 (currently developed on 2.5.3)

TASK.TITLE: #0000055 Add OnClick event for wxTreeMultiItem
#0000054 Add method IsItemRoot()
TASK.COMMENTS:
I create xmule preferences' dynamic control wxTreeMultiCtrl) from XML files. There are a *ton* of preferences, and thus even more controls (average of 1.8 controls per preference).
Not all -- in fact, only about 10% -- of the controls have to be loaded/created at startup.
Not all -- in fact, only the same 10% -- of the controls have to be seen at startup.
The most logical rubrick for determining visible/created controls is the first Preference grouping, General Settings.
My plan was to:
~ a) Parse all Sections (general, connection, etc) first, and add as Root nodes.
~ b) Have two custom events, EVT_NODE_EXPANDING and EVT_ROOT_EXPANDING (i have
done both)
~ c) When EVT_ROOT_EXPANDING is toggled, get the text from the root node (all
root nodes have nothing but text as values if i am correct (I am still having
problems implementing wxTreeMultiItem::SetLabel and GetLabel)
~ d) Load the xml + create controls for every thing inside the xml file under
<section>name</section>
~ e) optionally remove controls if EVT_ROOT_COLLAPSING is toggled.
Can this be added?

TASK.TITLE: #0000053 Add LibXRC wrapper
TASK.COMMENTS:
So the XRC code can be used:
<object class="wxTreeMultiCtrl" name="mycontrol">
~ <root>
~ <label>My Root</label>
~ <node>
~ <label>My Regular Node</label>
~ </node>
~ <multi_node>
~ <object class="wxStaticText">
~ <label>Nickname: </label>
~ </object>
~ <object class="wxTextCtrl" name="txt_nickname">
~ <label>HopeSeekr</label>
~ </object>
~ </multi_node>
~ </root>
</node>

TASK.TITLE: #0000086 When recursively enabling / disabling checkboxes, redraw checkboxes only
TASK.COMMENTS: Now a RedrawFromNode is used to refresh part of the tree, although the checkboxes are the only thing being redrawn. Use a wxClientDC to draw checkboxes.

TASK.TITLE: Alternating lines between the items
On folding, the edit ctrl should lose focus, to prevent chars being trapped in a hidden window
Add the checkboxview Getstatus contributed by that dude
Make it possible to NOT show the checkboxes. Simply the categories
TASK.COMMENTS: This also means the initial fold state should be expanded

TASK.TITLE: Make a static fold functionality. This means the fold does not work for the user
Make sure that after adding all spanning controls, that they are initially spanned
TASK.COMMENTS: When first starting a size event is needed for the spanning. A solution is a BeginUpdate and EndUpdate in the wxTreeMultiCtrl, where all the drawing and calculation is not yet done, but in the end it is. Other solution is posting a wxSizeEvent to the control from inside, only when a spanning control is added, or when spanning control is added, recalculate the spanning size with the RedrawFromNode

TASK.TITLE: Make a ReplaceWindow() method that replaces one window with another and performs the RedrawFromNode
XML Wizard Wrapper
Make a front end for multiple XML bases
For all errors related to XML, print row and column numbering
Also implement GetExtendedError for the parser so it tells what is wrong with the XML file
The event for the bool checkbox should immediately write back in the variable
TASK.COMMENTS: This needs to be examined that there is no chain reaction for example setting the checkbox 1 -> ID_A -> checkbox 2 -> ID_A -> checkbox 1 etc. So SetValue MUST NOT fire an event

TASK.TITLE: Remove memory leaks from app! I do not know where they came from
The string / edit needs size attributes, so that the width can be set
The string / edit needs reflecting of contents in var WATCH OUT FOR LOOP! event is fired when content is changed
Use wxNotifyEvent (or decendent) to send var changes. We simply hook up to the var's event handler where we derive from
Create a wxEvent based mechanism when a VAR is updated, that the developer can veto this or assign other values to variables
TASK.COMMENTS: These other assigned values should ofcourse NOT issue another event!

TASK.TITLE: Find a way to make sure that container vars cannot get more items after they are reflected
TASK.COMMENTS: Sometimes the container vars CAN handle multiple items like in a list box. Other times like in a radiobox it cannot happen. Maybe I simply need to make a replace mechanism for the wxTreeMultiCtrl

TASK.TITLE: change wxTreeMultiXmlMapper to a better descriptive class such as XmlTmcWizard
Some of the methods from specific classes (TmcListItem) need to be made not inline
Refactoring
Change the way the vars are coupled. Maybe instead of wxVarBase ptr in constructor use the actual needed var base
Change notification method, use wxNotifyEvent perhaps?
Refactor width of controls to method ApplyWidthAttribute that sets the width to a wnd when needed (DoCreateControls)
m_currentId should be incremented in DoCreateControls when the wnd pointer is != 0
TmcRadioBoxWindow
Does not yet show default checked state
Also implement row oriented v.s. column oriented listing
TASK.COMMENTS: maybe with maxrows="2" or maxcols="2" so the rows and columns are restricted.
